net.proteusframework.core.metric

Class Metric

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.core.metric.Metric
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AutoMetric, EmMetric, MilliMetric, PercentMetric, PixelMetric, PointMetric, UnknownMetric

    public abstract class Metric
extends Object
implements Cloneable, Serializable
    A Metric instance represents a single dimension measurement. It is intended to be a base class for different types of metrics that use different units, such as pixels, millimeters, percentages, etc. The class type will define what units are represented. The value of the metric is immutable.
    Since:
    0.10
    Author:
    Pat Double (double@i2rd.com)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setValue

        protected void setValue(double value)
        Set the value of this Metric object. This method should only be used once as the Metric class is supposed to be immutable. Other code will depend on this behavior.
        Parameters:
        value - The new metric value

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:

      • valueOf

        public static Metric valueOf(String str)
        This method parses a String metric value. The actual Metric implementation class is determined by the prefix to the decimal value. The following prefixes are allowed (case insensitive). If no prefix is given, an instance of UnknownMetric class is returned.
        • % - PercentMetric
        • px - PixelMetric
        • mm - MilliMetric
        • pt - PointMetric
        • em - EmMetric
        Parameters:
        str - A String representation of a Metric
        Returns:
        Metric.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the unit or value is invalid.
        NumberFormatException - if the String does not start with a decimal or sign.
